content:
Can somebody take a look at #9815, please? It is splitting the (still 2200-line file) PseudoMetric into two halves.

Since I filed it, it has accrued several merge conflicts - to the point where redo-ing seems easier to me than merging master and possibly making transcription errors in the process.
Before re-creating it, I'd like to have confirmation that this split is sensible.

In my opinion, this is not a perfect long-term split, but at least an improvement. (Feel welcome to propose a better split.
@Scott Morrison in case your offer to review splitting PRs quickly still applies
@Yaël Dillies since you have opinions about file splits; if you have something to add here, I'm interested!
I indeed have opinions and would love to review, but I am currently very busy so please don't block the PR on me if you haven't received my review by thursday
PseudoMetricAdvanced should be PseudoMetric/Bornology. Directories are your friend.
If rotting is a concern, I'm happy to merge once module docs are updated, and Yaël can make further changes if they want to. Otherwise let's wait for Thurday.
I think this is a pretty stable file, so not much rotting concerns

Git history shows at least six changes in the past two weeks. Any change to the second half of that file means I'll have to manually copy over the changes to the new code. That is work I'd prefer to not spend my time on.
